description.narrative: Tajikistan Water Supply and Sanitation Project, Phase III. The main goal is to strengthen policy development and reform at the national level in the sphere of drinking water supply and sanitation management and governance

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Revised technical norms and standards for construction of water supply and sanitation systems endorsed by the government (target: 1, baseline: 0) 1.2 Fully recoverable tariff calculation methodology approved by the government (target: 1 methodology approved, baseline: 1 methodology drafted) 1.3 Policy recommendations approved on taxation policy (target: 1 recommendation approved, baseline: 3 recommendation drafted 1.4 Law on Drinking water approved with new edition (including sanitation and gender equality) (target: 1 approved, baseline: 1 drafted) 2.1 State Sanitation Plan approved with specific action plans including gender sensitivity on access to sanitation facilities (target: 1 action plan, baseline: 0) 2.2 1 technical guideline on wastewater developed for sanitation sector operators and for rural women (target 1 guideline, baseline: 0) 3.1 At least 4 key water and sanitation policy briefs documented and published (target: 4 policy documents published, baseline: 0) 3.2 1 research paper on financial contribution of GoT and development partners in water and sanitation sector (target: 1 research paper, baseline: 0)

comment.narrative: 1.1 Revised technical norms and standards for construction of water supply and sanitation systems endorsed by the government (target: 1, baseline: 0) 1.2 Fully recoverable tariff calculation methodology approved by the government (target: 1 methodology approved, baseline: 1 methodology drafted) 1.3 Policy recommendations approved on taxation policy (target: 1 recommendation approved, baseline: 3 recommendation drafted 1.4 Law on Drinking water approved with new edition (including sanitation and gender equality) (target: 1 approved, baseline: 1 drafted) 2.1 State Sanitation Plan approved with specific action plans including gender sensitivity on access to sanitation facilities (target: 1 action plan, baseline: 0) 2.2 1 technical guideline on wastewater developed for sanitation sector operators and for rural women (target 1 guideline, baseline: 0) 3.1 At least 4 key water and sanitation policy briefs documented and published (target: 4 policy documents published, baseline: 0) 3.2 1 research paper on financial contribution of GoT and development partners in water and sanitation sector (target: 1 research paper, baseline: 0)

Output 1: Key elements of the reformed drinking water supply and sanitation policy are in effect (including taxation, tariffs, water quality, norms and standards): Indicator 1.1: Development and approval of a new version of the law on drinking water supply and wastewater disposal Indicator 1.2: Updating norms and standards for construction of water supply and sanitation systems Indicator 1.3: Development and approval of a methodology for calculating tariffs for water supply and sanitation services Indicator 1.4: Recommendations for improving tax policy
Output 2: Development of the state sanitary plan and sanitary and hygienic rules and regulations for the management of water supply and sanitation systems: Indicator 2.1: Preparation and approval of a sanitation development plan to improve access to sanitation Indicator 2.2: Development and approval of technical guidance for wastewater management
Output 3: Policy briefs and analysis of reforms in the drinking water supply and sanitation sector: Indicator 3.1: Preparation and publication of analytical reviews of water supply and sanitation policy Indicator 3.2: Study on financing water supply and sanitation sector development

Activity 1.1: Decree on tariff setting developed and approved by GoT Activity 1.2: Thematic Working Group (TWG) established on revision of construction norms and standards with emphasis on simplifying construction standards for affordable wastewater and sanitation infrastructure building in rural areas. Activity 1.3: Review of construction norms and standards in the area of wastewater (sanitation) in RoT and define needs for improvement; Activity 1.4: Develop construction norms and standards for wastewater in RoT. Activity 1.5: Elaboration of the policy recommendations on taxation of the drinking water sector. Activity 1. 6: Collect comments and feedback from respective government agencies for policy recommendations on taxation and submit for approval. Activity 1.7: Establish working groups for development of the by-laws of new edition of the law “On drinking water and wastewater” Activity 1.8: Develop and agree 2 by-laws of new edition of the law “On drinking water and wastewater” Activity 2.1: Establish Working Group to endorse Sanitation Development Plan (SDP). Activity 2.2: Develop State Sanitation Development plan. Activity 2.3: Present draft SDP to national and international stakeholders. Activity 2.4: Present draft SDP at province level. Activity 2.5: Establish working group for development on technical guideline on wastewater and safeguarding. Activity 2.6: Development of regulation on wastewater management and safeguarding of water source in partnership with the Government. Activity 3.1: 4 policy documents on (a) Tariff setting, (b) Taxation (c) Construction Norms and Standards of rural WS systems and (d) sanitation reform developed and published. Activity 3.2: Development and publishing of 5 media articles on (a) Tariff setting, (b) Taxation (c) Construction Norms and Standards of rural WS systems (d) sanitation reform and (e) drinking water governance in local media sources. Activity 3.3: Organization and conduction of the 2 meetings of Inter-ministerial working group on Drinking water and sanitation.
